t: For the choir director: according to “The Lily of Testimony.” A Miktam of David for teaching. When he fought with Aram-naharaim and Aram-zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in Salt Valley, killing twelve thousand.
God,*pn you have rejected us; you*ln have broken us down; you*ln have been angry. Restore us!
You*ln have shaken the land and split it open. Heal*ln its fissures, for it shudders.
You*ln have made your people suffer hardship; you*ln have given us wine to drink that*ln made us stagger.
You*ln have given a signal flag to those who fear you, so*ln that they can flee before the archers. Selah*ig
Save*ln with your right hand, and answer me, so*ln that those you love may be rescued.
God*pn has spoken in his sanctuary: “I*ln will celebrate! I*ln will divide up Shechem. I*ln will apportion the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead*ln is mine, Manasseh is mine, and*ln Ephraim is my helmet; Judah*ln is my scepter.
Moab*ln is my washbasin. I*ln throw my sandal on Edom; I*ln shout in triumph over Philistia.”
Who*pn will bring me to the fortified city? Who*ln will lead me to Edom?
God,*ln haven’t you rejected us? God,*ln you do not march out with our armies.
Give*ln us aid against the foe, for*ln human help is worthless.
With*ln God we will perform valiantly; he*ln will trample our foes.
